towns.town: wäräda Ganta Afäšum, ṭabiya Bukot, qušät Nəḥbi

founders.founder: The church may be an Aksumite foundation. Aksumite remains (a massive stone bowl, pillar) are found in the church compound. Local tradition does not specify the time of the foundation, but tells that Yǝsḥaq, the founder of Gundä Gunde and adherent of the Stephanite movement, established the monastic community at the church of Nǝḥbi before going to the area where he founded later Gundä Gunde (The Vita of Yǝsḥaq tells only that he was a native of Nəḥbä in ʿAgamä). As other churches and monasteries of the area, the monastic community of Nǝḥbi was favored by däğğazmač Subagadis Wäldu, in the early 19th cent., but it declined in the early 20th cent. During the Italian period another church dedicated to Zärʾa Buruk was established nearby under the administration of Nǝḥbi Mikaʾel, but it declined in the early 20th cent.

conditions.condition: Gädam. It is considered a monastery, but currently there are no monks. Tabots (5): Minas (marble), two of Michael, Bäʾata Maryam (?), Zärʾa Buruk (in additional small church).

descriptions.description: 18 Mss. photographed: NSM-001 "The Faith of the Fathers"; NSM-002 "The Rite of the Holy Week"; NSM-003 "Four Gospels"; NSM-004 "Homily of St. Michael"; NSM-005 "Vita of Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus"; NSM-006 "The Book of the Funeral Rite"; NSM-007 "Miracles of Mary"; NSM-008 "Vita of Täklä Haymanot"; NSM-009 "The Book of the Matrimony Rite"; NSM-010 "Missal"; NSM-011 "Prayer of Incense"; NSM-012 "Synaxarion (March)"; NSM-013 "Synaxarion (September)"; NSM-014 "Missal"; NSM-015 "Vita of Zärʾa Buruk"; NSM-016 "Missal"; NSM-017 "Vita of Kiros"; NSM-018 "Prayer of Mary". Objects.
